name: #ExtinctAnimals No.03 The Last Giant Short-faced Bear (DNA)
description:
Arctodus simus. Extinct. Pleistocene. North America. 

“The Giant short-faced bear was a brutish predator that overwhelmed other large mammals of the Pleistocene with its great physical strength.” 

Using steganography this JPEG has been encoded with the sequenced DNA of the Giant short-faced bear. The image therefore hides the genetic code of the animal within. 

#ExtinctAnimals is a collection of pixelated fauna representing the last specimens of species that disappeared from earth. Bright pixels, fossil records and genetic descendants are all we have left. As an NFT, each of these images is unique, finite, and scarce -- much like the last extinct animals they depict.
